chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
R: Type
Rone: R
Rzero: R
Rminus: R -> R -> R
Rmult: R -> R -> R
Rplus: R -> R -> R
Ropp: R -> R
R_is_ring: ring_theory z o Rplus Rmult Rminus ∸ eq
k: R
n: nat
U: M22

Goal:
expo22 n (M22scal k U) = M22scal (expoR n k) (expo22 n U)

Premises:
Notation expoR := (mscal Rmult o)
Inductive eq (A : Type) (x : A) : A -> Prop := eq_refl : x = x Arguments eq {A}%type_scope Arguments eq_refl {A}%type_scope {x}, [A] _
M22 = (R * R * R * R)%type : Type
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
ring_theory : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> Prop
Notation o := Rone
Notation expo22 := (mscal MU22 ID_22)
M22scal = fun (k : R) (X : M22) => let (p, x) := X in (let (p0, x) := p in (let (u, v) := p0 in fun w z : R => (k ⊗ u, k ⊗ v, k ⊗ w, k ⊗ z)) x) x : R -> M22 -> M22
Notation z := Rzero
Rring_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list R) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr Z), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist z o Rplus Rmult Rminus ∸ eq (gen_phiZ z o Rplus Rmult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N o Rmult) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval z o Rplus Rmult Rminus ∸ (gen_phiZ z o Rplus Rmult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N o Rmult) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval z o Rplus Rmult Rminus ∸ (gen_phiZ z o Rplus Rmult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N o Rmult) l pe2
mscal_M22scal : forall (n : nat) (x : M22), mscal PL22 ZE_22 n x = M22scal (mscal Rplus z n o) x
msum_mscal : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n k : nat) (f : nat -> X), (forall i j : nat, i < n -> j < n -> m (f i) (f j) = m (f j) (f i)) -> msum m u n (fun i : nat => mscal m u k (f i)) = mscal m u k (msum m u n f)
msum_msum : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n k : nat) (f : nat -> nat -> X), (forall i1 j1 i2 j2 : nat, i1 < n -> j1 < k -> i2 < n -> j2 < k -> m (f i1 j1) (f i2 j2) = m (f i2 j2) (f i1 j1)) -> msum m u n (fun i : nat => msum m u k (f i)) = msum m u k (fun j : nat => msum m u n (fun i : nat => f i j))
OrderedRing.mk_SOR_theory : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req -> (forall x1 x2 : R, req x1 x2 -> forall y1 y2 : R, req y1 y2 -> req (rplus x1 y1) (rplus x2 y2)) -> (forall x1 x2 : R, req x1 x2 -> forall y1 y2 : R, req y1 y2 -> req (rtimes x1 y1) (rtimes x2 y2)) -> (forall x1 x2 : R, req x1 x2 -> req (ropp x1) (ropp x2)) ->...-> OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt
Rmul_assoc : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)
Radd_assoc : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z)
Rdistr_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (rmul (radd x y) z) (radd (rmul x z) (rmul y z))

MI22 = fun X : M22 => let (p, x) := X in (let (p0, x) := p in (let (a, b) := p0 in fun c d : R => (∸ a, ∸ b, ∸ c, ∸ d)) x) x : M22 -> M22

Rth_ARth : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req

ARadd_assoc : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z)

Ropp_add : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (ropp (radd x y)) (radd (ropp x) (ropp y))
scal_one : forall (X : Type) (sum times : X -> X -> X) (zero one : X), monoid_theory sum zero -> (forall x u v : X, sum x u = sum x v -> u = v) -> monoid_theory times one -> (forall x y z : X, times x (sum y z) = sum (times x y) (times x z)) -> (forall x y z : X, times (sum y z) x = sum (times y x) (times z x)) -> forall (k : nat) (x : X), mscal sum zero k x = times (mscal sum zero k one) x
